document.ModsDocTitle: New species of the Rhaconotusjacobsoni group (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Doryctinae) from Vietnam
document.docAuthor: Oanh, Nguyen Thi & Long, Khuat Dang
document.masterDocTitle: New species of the Rhaconotusjacobsoni group (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Doryctinae) from Vietnam

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of the Rhaconotusjacobsoni group (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Doryctinae) from Vietnam

subSubSection.paragraph: Rhaconotus robustus Long sp. nov. Figs 25, 26-36
Holotype, male, "Doryc.722" (IEBR), NW Vietnam: Hoa Binh, Mai Chau, Tan Son, orchard, MT, 20°43'10.3"N 104°59'47.0"E , 950m, 1-5.v.2010, KD Long.

Antenna with 46 segments (male); occipital carina finely complete medio-dorsally, fading below distal to hypostomal carina above base of mandible (Fig. 27); frons slightly depressed, with sparse fine striae (Fig. 26); vertex and temple shiny, smooth; distance from pronotal carina to mesonotum equal to distance from carina to anterior margin of pronotum; in lateral view, metanotum with short pointed tooth; precoxal sulcus narrow, straight, crenulate (Fig. 30); mesopleuron and metapleuron finely granulate; notauli shallow, sparsely crenulate anteriorly, slightly widened posteriorly, with two longitudinal convergent carinae running close to scutellar sulcus (Fig. 29); propodeum with baso-lateral areas emarginated by carina (Fig. 32); median carina in basal 0.5; pterostigma 4.4 x as long as wide; fore wing vein 3-SR 2.7 x vein r; vein 1-CU1 0.12 x vein 2-CU1 (Fig. 35); second submarginal cell slightly widened apically, basal length 3.1 x its maximum width and 1.6 x subdiscal cell; vein 1-M of hind wing 4.25 x vein 1r-m (Fig. 36); inner side of fore tibia with six spines; hind coxa finely granulate; hind tibia robust, 8.5 x its maximum width; first metasomal tergite nearly parallel-sided, 2.5 x its apical width (Fig. 33), finely granulate basally, longitudinally striate apically; second-fifth tergites longitudinally striate; sixth tergite rugo-striate basally, almost smooth apically (Fig. 31).
Male, body length 5.9 mm; fore wing length 3.7 mm (Fig. 25).

Head. Antenna with 46 segments; scapus dorsally 1.3 x longer than its maximum width; third antennal segment 1.1 x as long fourth segment; in dorsal view; temple roundly behind eye; head width 1.3 x its median length (Fig. 26); median length of head 1.8 x as long as temple; height of eye 1.3 x temple; in lateral view, transverse diameter of eye 1.2 x length of temple; eye 1.4 x longer than its width (Fig. 27); ocelli small, basal side of ocellar triangle 1.5 x lateral sides; POL 1.5 x as long as OD, and 0.6 x OOL (Fig. 26); in frontal view, eye 2.3 x as high as broad; malar space 0.4 x height of eye, 1.3 x as long as basal width of mandible (Fig. 28); face width 1.1 x height of eye, and 1.3 x height of face and clypeus combined; width of hypoclypeal depression 0.8 x as long distance from edge of depression to eye, 0.4 x as wide as face, and 1.2 x as wide as basal width of mandible; distance between tentorial pits 1.1 x as long as long distance from pit to eye; occipital carina complete, fading below distal to hypostomal carina above base of mandible (Fig. 27); head with long sparse setae, roundly narrowed below eyes (Fig. 26); length of maxillary palp 1.4 x height of head (without mandible); frons slightly depressed medially, with sparse fine striae; vertex and shiny, smooth (Fig. 26); face rugo-coriaceous; clypeus rugose (Fig. 28).

Mesosoma. Mesosoma depressed, its dorsal side almost flat; length 2.1 x its height (Fig. 30); pronotum with median transverse carina; notauli narrow, sparsely crenulate anteriorly, slightly widened posteriorly with two longitudinal convergent carinae running close to scutellar sulcus (Fig. 29); pronotal side almost flat, coriaceous medially, coarsely rugose posteriorly, finely granulate ventrally; precoxal sulcus long, narrow, crenulate; subalar depression largely crenulate; mesopleuron finely granulate (Fig. 30); mesoscutum and scutellum finely granulate; propodeum with baso-lateral areas emarginated by carinae (Fig. 32); median carina in basal 0.5 of propodeum; baso-lateral area finely granulate; propodeal areola rugose.

Wings. Fore wing 4.1 x as long as its maximum width; pterostigma 4.4 x as long as wide; vein r arising behind middle of pterostigma (distance from apex of pterostigma to vein r 0.7 x distance from vein r to base of pterostigma); vein 1-R1 1.2 x as long as pterostigma; vein 3-SR 2.7 x vein r, and 0.6 x vein SR1, and 1.3 x vein 2-SR; vein m-cu distinctly postfurcal; second submarginal cell of fore wing slightly widened apically (Fig. 35), basal length 3.1 x as long as its maximum width, and 1.6 x as long as subdiscal cell; subdiscal cell roundly closed on level of vein m-cu; vein 1-CU1 equal to vein cu-a, and 0.12 x vein 2-CU1 (Fig. 35); hind wing 6.7 x as long as wide; vein M+CU 0.3 x vein 1-M; vein 1-M 4.25 x vein 1r-m (Fig. 36).

Legs. Fore tarsus 1.5 x as long as fore tibia; inner side of fore tibia with six spines; hind coxa with baso-ventral tooth, finely granulate; hind femur robust (Fig. 34), length of hind femur, tibia and basitarsus 2.5, 8.5 and 10.5 x their maximum width, respectively; outer side of hind tibia with long semi-erected setae, length of seta 1.5 x maximum width of tibia (Fig. 34); inner hind tibial spur 0.3 x as long as hind basitarsus; hind tarsus 0.9 x as long as hind tibia; basitarsus 0.8 x as long as second-fifth tarsal segments combined; second tarsus 0.4 x as long as basitarsus, and 1.1 x as long as fifth tarsus (without pretarsus); fourth tarsus 0.6 x fifth tarsus.

Metasoma. Metasoma 1.3 x as long as head and mesosoma combined; first metasomal tergite nearly parallel-sided (Fig. 33); length of first metasomal tergite 2.5 x apical width, and 1.4 x length of propodeum; second metasomal tergite with narrow lenticular apical area separated with shallow crenulate furrow, length of lenticular apical area 0.3 x length of second tergite (Fig. 31); length of second tergite 0.9 x as long as its basal width, and 0.7 x length of third tergite; first metasomal tergite with two dorsal carinae in basal 0.5 of tergite; finely granulate basally, longitudinally striate apically (Fig. 33); second-fifth tergites longitudinally striate; sixth tergite sparsely setose, rugo-striate basally, almost smooth apically (Fig. 31).

Colour. Body black, antenna yellow, but brown apically; scapus brownish yellow; head black with yellow semi-circular stripe around eye dorso-laterally (Fig. 27); palpi brown, except apical segment of labial palp and two apical segments of maxillary palp yellow; fore and middle legs yellow; hind coxa and femur yellowish brown; hind tibia and tarsus yellow; tegula brownish yellow; wing veins pale brown; pterostigma pale brown, cream white basally (Fig. 35); wing membrane hyaline with smoky spots medially.

caption.paragraph: Figure 25. Rhaconotus robustus Long, sp. nov., male, holotype (habitus, lateral view).

Figures 26-36. Rhaconotus robustus Long, sp. nov., male, holotype 26 head, dorsal view 27 head, lateral view 28 head, frontal view 29 mesonotum, dorsal view 30 mesopleuron 31 tergites 2-6, dorsal view 32 propodeum 33 first metasomal tergite 34 hind femur and tibia 35 fore wing 36 hind wing.

subSubSection.paragraph: From robustus (Latin for strong), because of the robust hind femur.
